repo_notes.content: Rapida: The open source platform for building voice agents.

pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the Rapida voice AI platform, its purpose, core principles (reliable, observable, customizable), and high-level capabilities

pages.title: Architecture Overview
pages.purpose: Explain the overall system architecture, microservices design, voice orchestration pipeline, and how components interact

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Guide users through initial setup, running the platform with Docker Compose, and making their first voice call

pages.title: Configuration System
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the AppConfig structure, environment variables, service configuration, and how settings propagate across microservices

pages.title: Application Configuration
pages.purpose: Document the AppConfig struct, required fields, validation, and configuration loading mechanisms

pages.title: Environment Variables
pages.purpose: List and explain all environment variables used across services, including database, Redis, and inter-service communication settings

pages.title: Data Layer
pages.purpose: Explain the data persistence architecture, including PostgreSQL databases, Redis caching, and OpenSearch indexing

pages.title: Database Connectors
pages.purpose: Document the Connector abstraction, PostgresConnector, RedisConnector, and OpenSearchConnector implementations

pages.title: Database Schemas
pages.purpose: Detail the database schemas for each service, including assistant conversations, endpoints, integrations, and relationships

pages.title: Caching Strategy
pages.purpose: Explain Redis usage patterns, query caching, session management, and cache invalidation strategies

pages.title: Microservices
pages.purpose: Overview of the microservices architecture, inter-service communication, and service responsibilities

pages.title: Web API
pages.purpose: Document the web-api service, its role as the primary backend, authentication, and routing responsibilities

pages.title: Assistant API
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the assistant-api service, voice orchestration, conversation management, and the GenericRequestor component

pages.title: Endpoint API
pages.purpose: Explain the endpoint-api service, LLM endpoint management, caching, retry policies, and logging

pages.title: Integration API
pages.purpose: Document the integration-api service, external integrations, webhook handling, and audit logging

pages.title: Document API
pages.purpose: Explain the document-api service, document processing, knowledge base management, and vector search

pages.title: Voice Orchestration
pages.purpose: Explain the RAPIDA ORCHESTRATOR, conversation lifecycle, state management, and real-time audio processing

pages.title: Conversation Management
pages.purpose: Document conversation creation, message handling, state transitions, interruptions, and recording

pages.title: Audio Input Processing
pages.purpose: Explain audio preprocessing, denoising (RNNoise), VAD (Silero), end-of-speech detection, and buffering

pages.title: Audio Output Processing
pages.purpose: Document TTS synthesis, audio buffering (20ms chunks), interruption handling, and streaming delivery

pages.title: Telephony Integration
pages.purpose: Overview of telephony provider support, call control, and audio streaming over WebSocket

pages.title: Telephony Interface
pages.purpose: Document the Telephony abstraction, common methods (MakeCall, IncomingCall, StatusCallback, Streamer)

pages.title: Twilio Integration
pages.purpose: Explain Twilio-specific implementation, TwiML generation, WebSocket streaming, and Î¼-law audio handling

pages.title: Vonage Integration
pages.purpose: Document Vonage-specific implementation, NCCO generation, WebSocket streaming, and PCM audio handling

pages.title: Exotel Integration
pages.purpose: Explain Exotel-specific implementation, custom field routing, WebSocket streaming, and audio format handling

pages.title: AI Provider Integration
pages.purpose: Overview of the transformer architecture for speech-to-text and text-to-speech, supporting multiple AI providers

pages.title: Speech-to-Text Transformers
pages.purpose: Document the SpeechToTextTransformer interface and implementations for Google, Deepgram, Sarvam, AssemblyAI, Cartesia

pages.title: Text-to-Speech Transformers
pages.purpose: Document the TextToSpeechTransformer interface and implementations for Google, Deepgram, Sarvam, Cartesia, Elevenlabs, Resemble

pages.title: Provider Configuration
pages.purpose: Explain audio format mapping, credential management, model options, and provider-specific settings

pages.title: Frontend
pages.purpose: Overview of the React UI, voice agent interface, activity monitoring, and provider configuration
